contentrichtext.text: '''[[Homer]]''' is the name given to the purported author of the Ancient Greek poems the ''Iliad'' and the ''Odyssey''. '''Homer''' can also refer to: {{TOCright}} ==Places== In the '''United States''': *[[Homer, Alaska]] *[[Homer, Georgia]] *[[Homer, Illinois]] *[[Homer, Indiana]] *[[Homer, Kansas]] *[[Homer, Louisiana]] *[[Homer, Michigan]] *[[Homer, Minnesota]] *[[Homer, Nebraska]] *[[Homer (town), New York]] **[[Homer (village), New York]] *[[Homer, Ohio]] *[[Homer, Texas]] *[[Homer, Wisconsin]] {{seealso|Homer City, Pennsylvania|Homer Township (disambiguation)}} In '''England''': *[[Homer, Shropshire]] In '''outer space''': * [[Homer (crater)]], a crater on Mercury ==Other uses== {{wiktionary|homer}} * [[Homer (name)]] * A [[home run]] in the sport of baseball * [[Homer (unit)]], a unit of volume * [[Homing beacon]] (also known as a "homer"), a type of tracking transmitter * Homer, the NATO reporting name for the Soviet [[Mil Mi-12]] helicopter * A [[Racing Homer]], a type of racing pigeon * [[HOMER1]], or Homer homolog 1 (Drosophila), a human gene * [[Prince Homer]], a small truck produced by the Prince Motor Company and later by Nissan ==See also== * [[Homerus of Byzantium]] (c. 280 BC), grammarian and tragic poet * [[5700 Homerus]], an asteroid named after the Greek poet * [[Homeric (disambiguation)]] * [[Omero]], the Italian version of the given name Homer {{disambiguation|geo}}
